page.title: 07BIOGRAPHY PHILIP PRIESTNER
page.content: {PHILIP PRIESTNER}started work on farm at age of 14."2/6d.a week and my keep" Bought his first ex-army wagon in 1949 for Â£110.He collected salt from North wich,lime from N.Wales.Hauling loads to deliver to the fields"shovelled it off the backs of wagon to the lime- spreader at 15 shillings a load."In 1951 bought second lorry employing driver.Now his family business employs over 40 people including 33 full time H.G.V.drivers.They carry chemicals, detergents and steel.This 56 year old man seldom takes a holiday away for more than a few days.He is married to Beryl and his two daughters Jackie and Kerry both work in the office.A computer has recently been installed which will replace most of the manual office proceedure this year.
